result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliott Bernard Russ Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton appeared by video for Elliott Bernard Russ Jr.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken  for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 02/03/2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defense received discovery and requested more time to review with defendant.  Case adjourned for status conference October 13, 2022 at 1:30 pm, by zoom.

Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in court by video with Attorney Justin L. Singleton who appears in person.  Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense would like to move exhibits into evidence. Arguments are heard by the parties; motion is denied at this time. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Z. Cvetan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
New Lisbon not available by video 7/26/2022 at 10:30am. Defense Atty notified; selected a new date. Next date will be 7/28/2022 at 2:30pm. Parties notified.

Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court, appear by video. Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. New Lisbon Corrections fail to produce defendant for court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of completion
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in court, appear by video with attorney Thomas James appear by video for attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney James state attorney Singleton needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. DEFENDANTS DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 059588,

Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Elliott Bernard Russ in custody at New Lisbon Correctional.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elliott Bernard Russ appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
